msgSnippet: ... filename? Sorry, should have been more clear and correct: use System.getProperty to do something with Java properties. If you have a lot of them and want
messageBody:
--- Andy Kriger <akriger@...> wrote:
>forgive a novice-sounding question, but doesn't this still involve
>hardcoding, just a properties filename instead of a test data
filename?

Sorry, should have been more clear and correct: use System.getProperty
to do something with Java properties. If you have a lot of them and
want to separate yours from the system properties, use
java.util.Properties on a file name in a system property.

This way, if you only have a couple, you use System.getProperty to
retrieve and can set them on the command line:

java -Dmytests.filename=foo.txt com.mycom.ClassTest

If you have many, you can use System.getProperty to specify a
properties file:

java -Dcom.mycom.properties=myprops.txt com.mycom.ClassTest

Regards,

Rob
